<<<<<<< HEAD
The vnbeliefe of St. Thomas the Apostle laid open for the comfort of all that desire to belieue. Whereunto is added a comfortable treatise for all that are afflicted in soule or body. The first armeth vs against despaire in the houre of death; the second against impatience vnder the crosse. By Nicholas Bound, Doctor in Diuinitie. Bownd, Nicholas, d. 1613. Bownd, Nicholas, d. 1613. Treatise ful of consolation. aut
[8], 201, [1] p.
Printed [by J. Legat] for Robert Allot at the blacke Beare in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1628.
Another issue, with cancel general title page, of Bownd, Nicholas. The unbeleefe of S. Thomas the apostle (STC 3441.5). In two parts. Includes Bownd, Nicholas. A Treatise ful of consolation. Printer's name from STC. Running title reads: The vnbeleefe of S. Thomas. Imperfect; print show through. Lacks part 2. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
